I learned a lot from field trips.

I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Stefan Renckens  Stefan was an excellent TA. He was responsive and provided very useful feedback on my assignments. He was knowledgable and had interesting insights in class.
Instructor: Stefan Renckens  Stefan Renckens
Instructor: Stefan Renckens  Stefan Renckens

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The seminar was a fascinating springboard for deeper analysis of institutions. It would have been excellent if the instructor had structured discussion more or spent a part of each class lecturing.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The theory
The best aspect of this course was learning both theory and its application to real world case studies.
Ben's a really engaging (and knowledgeable) lecturer and facilitator, and the readings for each week were generally interesting/well-selected.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Pace. It was too fast.

This course could be vastly improved with more participation from Professor Cashore. Too much responsibility was placed on students, who are relatively unfamiliar with the material, to teach and lead discussions. A better balance would have been for Professor Cashore to lecture for half of the class and have students lead discussion for the second half.

It was great that everyone got the opportunity to lead a class and sometimes the discussion was productive, but often it felt like we'd get trapped going around in circles until Ben or Stefan redirected us. Maybe splitting the class into professor-led and student-led discussion parts would help mitigate that.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Stefan Renckens  He took the time to read and provided very specific input for assignments. That was really useful to me and I appreciated it.
Instructor: Stefan Renckens  He gave clear explanations and feedback on work and was very responsive to emails.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It relates to y work on global environmental govlernance
I found this course very applicable to my work on climate change adaptation among vulnerable communities because it gave me a new lens through which to analyze my particular case study.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It helps me understand better the theoretical underpinnings of institutions.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes - I would have like more time for discussions!

The course gave me an excellent introduction and resources into how to analyze institutions and their role in environmental policy; however, the course did not meet my expectations in going beyond just a mere introduction.

We spent a little more time on how to read the institutionalist literature (i.e., deciphering the epistemological assumptions behind different arguments) than I'd expected, but the class was interesting and has changed how I evaluate recommendations for institutional reform.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The advantage of working with a partner on leading class discussion was that I was able to better understand the material through active debate.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Start readingearly! Prepare very well for class, the discussions will require that you have read thoroughly.
Be prepared to read and talk a lot.
